extension.name: ST HSM RTOS Portable Kernel Component

image.text: HSM RTOS has been licensed to STMicroelectronics for use in resident system application code in SPC5 microcontrollers.

property.brief: Size, in bits, of the system tick counter.
property.name: System Tick Counter Resolution

property.brief: System Tick frequency in Hz.
property.name: System Tick Clock Frequency

property.brief: System Tick mode, tickless mode enables a more power-efficient mode.
property.name: System Tick Mode
property.text: Tickless mode requires support of a special dedicated timer and the implementation of the "ST" driver at HAL level. If such a timer is not available then select the periodic system tick mode.

property.brief: Minimum number of ticks in sleep/timeout directives.
property.name: System Tick Delta
property.text: This values is the minimum number of ticks specifiable in a sleep/timeout directive. Usually 2 is fine unless trying extreme system tick frequencies.

group.name: Hooks
group.description: The kernel functionality can be extended by using the hooks mechanisms. Hooks allow to insert user-defined code in specific kernel code paths. Note that hook code is inserted into a macro definition so lines must be terminated by a \.

property.brief: This code is hooked into the NIL_CFG_SYSTEM_INIT_HOOK macro.
property.name: System Initialization Hook

property.brief: This code is hooked into the NIL_CFG_THREAD_EXT_FIELDS macro.
property.name: Thread Extra Fields Hook

property.brief: This code is hooked into the NIL_CFG_THREAD_EXT_INIT_HOOK macro.
property.name: Thread Initialization Hook

property.brief: This code is hooked into the NIL_CFG_IDLE_ENTER_HOOK macro.
property.name: Idle Enter Hook

property.brief: This code is hooked into the NIL_CFG_SYSTEM_HALT_HOOK macro.
property.name: System Halt Hook

group.name: Tasks Configuration
group.text: Tasks are defined as a priority reverse-ordered list, the first element is the highest priority task in the system. Priorities are fixed and cannot change at runtime.

Each task will be placed in its own .c file placed under ./source/tasks and named as lower-case of the task symbolic name prefixed by "task_", a global tasks.c file shall also be generated containing the tasks table and shared code.

property.brief: List of the tasks to be created on startup.
property.name: Tasks

group.name: Task Settings

property.brief: This is the readable name of the task as shown into NIL-aware debuggers.
property.name: Readable Name

property.brief: C name used for the task, the name must be a valid C identifier.
property.name: Symbolic Name
property.text: A task function will be created using this name. A working area will also be statically allocated for the task with "_wa" suffix to this name.

property.brief: Size of the stack to be statically allocated for the task.
property.name: Stack Size

property.brief: Argument to be passed to the task, the argument is expected to be a valid C expression compatible with (void *).
property.name: Argument

group.text: Task code to be generated into the output file under ./source/tasks.

property.brief: Task C module code.
property.name: Task Code
property.text: Put your task code in this box, a task template code is generated by default. Note that if this bos is fully empty then the task file is not generated and the user can define the task in any other module, task initialization is still generated.

group.text: Code to be placed in ./source/tasks/tasks.c before the generated taks table.

property.brief: Shared code to be placed in ./source/tasks.c (if any).
property.name: Shared Code
